page.title: 20ST. ALBAN'S CHURCH
page.content:
The original St. Alban's Church was built in St. Alban's Road, shortly after the end of the second World War. It was rebuilt on its present site at Bartons Road in 1966. The Parish boundary follows the Havant District boundary to the east and north and cuts south to follow the line of the Petersfield Road. The population of the area seems to be getting older, and this is reflected in the increase in the numbers of funerals performed at the Church, and the fewer baptisms undertaken. The Church runs outings for the elderly and these are very popular.
This work was produced by members of the 3rd Havant Scout Group of Meyrick Road, Havant.
